title.narrative: 6.2. MONITORING, EVALUATION AND RESEARCH

description.narrative: 6.2. Increased capacity of the Government to manage monitoring, evaluation and research for quality analysis related to child rights, gender equality, social protection and inclusion, which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Evaluation And Research, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Disadvantaged children increasingly benefit from an improved policy environment and systems guided by quality research and data.

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)

description.narrative: General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 6.2. Increased capacity of the Government to manage monitoring, evaluation and research for quality analysis related to childrights, gender equality, social protection and inclusion

description.narrative: MoSD has developed quality reports for the CRC and CRPD. PCBS has piloted Census, paved the way to the adoption of the SDG indicators and launched the preparations for MICS 6 | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Updated CRC report available

actual.value: 2017:CRC State party report has been submitted to MoFA

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Updated CRC report available

actual.value: 2016:CRC State party report second draft has been developed incorporating feedback from Line Ministries and stakeholders

title.narrative: Availability of national sex disaggregated data on child rights realisation, including data on CWD

target.value: 2016:Yes, National Youth Survey, Situation Analysis for Children with Disabilities, CRPD state party report, Census,

actual.value: 2017:Yes, National Youth Survey, Situation Analysis for Children with Disabilities, CRPD state party report, Census,MoV: National Youth Survey, Situation Analysis for Children with Disabilities, CRPD state party report and Census report.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Availability of national sex disaggregated data on child rights realisation, including data on CWD

target.value: 2017:Yes (National Youth Survey, Situation Analysis for Children with Disabilities, CRPD state party report, Census report).

actual.value: 2016:Yes, The Situation analysis for Children with Disability report and national youth survey are available. The CRPD State party report initial draft is well underway.
